result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

8:17 AM Defendant Christopher F Leonard in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen Jr. in court for Christopher F Leonard.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed. Attorney Jensen is asking for a quick plea/sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing, filed by Attorney Jensen.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 2, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with Pick N Save/Brandon W listed in the Criminal Complaint.

1:20 PM Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen Jr. in court for Christopher F Leonard. Defendant Christopher F Leonard in court, in custody.   Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defendant states he does not have an address or phone but will be in custody at the Waukesha County Jail for three months.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  Attorney Jensen requests this matter be set for November 2, 2022 and states he will be taking this case and no status of counsel date is needed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 08:15 am.
